title: Riot, you're making me want to explore your world
body: Please tell me you're developing single player games set in Runeterra.  Like a point and click adventure game set in Piltover and Zaun.  PLEASE!!!!!

replies.body: I have a feeling they are making a mmorpg. Which would be pretty cool.

We would meet with the champions.
Lore established characters would be bosses.

I want to do a quest for demacia reputation.

I want to help Piltover stop a spree of Jinx's crimes.

I want to fight Mordekaiser, raid boss heroic mode.

I want to make Shurima great again.

Please I want.

Goddamn I just nerded out there.

I kinda doubt it, but it really would be pretty cool.
And not only because of lore, but also because they'd _have_ to revolutionize the genre with a refereshing and much more modern take on the MMORPG. (I'm not sure how such a thing would be done, though, at the moment.)

I mean, I'm certain that Riot's designers are aware of the problems of the MMORPG genre and how not many of its games, nowadays, offer different things. ;P

It would be awesome. And yeah if Riot came out with one it would crush so many other games. 

But we shall see I truly hope they do, to be honest it would foolish of them not to do so it would take the game to new heights!

And the story line would be amazing!

**_Blitzcrank's Poro Roundup:_**

_Singleplayer?_ ✓
_Runeterra?_ ✓
_Point and click?_ X
_Adventure in Piltover and Zaun?_ ✓✓✓

You're 5/6th's covered!

---

Anyways though, an adventure game would be super cool.

They're definitely making a 2D fighting game. Riot acquired the team that made Rising Thunder.

Hopefully the result is a game that's better than Rising Thunder though that game is ass.

Dude, I can't wait to kick some ass with Bard. Provided, they add him to the game.

#bardforfights

Why explore their world when you can just watch Two Towers instead?

sorry, sorry, just demacia looks like it was taken straight from a peter jackson film. it looks so much like gondor I was confused for a bit when I first saw the pictures.
Yeah, I feel like there is no way they would make all of these huge, HD landscape concepts without having something big planned
